headline: Teens on France's social media ban for under-15s: 'We're going back to the Stone Age'
description: The measure to ban social media for those under age 15 would affect mostly middle schoolers. About a dozen of them shared their concerns with Le Monde about a law set to upend their online lives.

headline: US envoy Witkoff says 'meaningful progress' made in Ukraine war talks
'The spectacle of European disunity in the face of pressure from both the United States and China is infuriating'
Nine arrested in murder probe over far-right activist's death in Lyon
description: A parliamentary aide from the radical-left party La France Insoumise was among those arrested over the fatal beating of Quentin Deranque, a 23-year-old far-right activist.

headline: In Kyiv, a fourth winter of war spares no one
description: In the freezing Ukrainian capital, residents are regularly without heat and electricity. People get by through resourcefulness and solidarity, living with a sense of inevitability.

headline: Snow camping at ski resorts: 'Our friends think we're crazy'
description: Although many have disappeared, 'caravaneige' campsites – those that welcome campers and caravans in the snow – are still enjoying good times at high altitudes, driven by a new generation of skiing campers and their unbeatable prices.

headline: Némésis, the identitarian activists behind feminist masks
description: Named for the Greek goddess of retribution, the French group specializes in provocative protests and perpetually blames immigrants and Muslims for sexual violence. Since its creation in 2019, members have regularly infiltrated left-wing protests to shout their own slogans.

headline: Trump announces Japan's $36 billion investment in the US
French Interior Minister eases bilateral tensions by reviving 'security cooperation' with Algeria
Peru's Congress impeaches interim President Jose Jeri
Paul Magnette, political scientist: 'If Trump and his friends were truly convinced of their superiority, would they spend so much time trying to divide Europeans?'
Mexico seeks to bring its archaeological treasures back from France
Iran and US agree on 'guiding principles' for a deal, say Iranian officials
Storms decimate thousands of puffins on France's Atlantic coast
Jesse Jackson, pastor and civil rights icon, dies at 84
In an open letter, dozens of film figures slam Berlin Film Festival 'silence' on Gaza
'Unprecedented' flooding in France is expected to last all week
Chinese kung-fu robots steal the show in world's most-watched TV program
French prosecutors intervene in defense of TotalEnergies in climate trial
'Marty Supreme,' with Timothée Chalamet: An existential and frenetic table tennis journey
description: Director and screenwriter Josh Safdie, now working apart from his brother Benny, gives the 'Dune' star the standout role of his career as a brash table tennis player inspired by Marty Reisman.

headline: At Navalny's grave, two years after his death in a Russian prison: 'We are not alone'
description: Several hundred supporters of the Kremlin's most renowned opponent gathered on Monday at the Moscow cemetery where he is buried. A new investigation confirmed the cause of his death: assassination by poisoning.

headline: The Epstein case: Thirty years of judicial negligence, at the expense of victims
description: The first complaints against the millionaire date back to 1996. Yet between his initial conviction in 2008 and his arrest in the summer of 2019, he was never troubled by the justice system.

headline: Rejecting political violence
Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei: The twilight of a tyrant
'The Mediterranean does not have to be a graveyard. Preventable failures are turning it into one'
